info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 7:16PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Lewis and Clark, western Teton and northwestern Cascade Counties through 800 PM MDT... At 715 PM MDT, radar and automated surface observations reported strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles west of Augusta to near Wolf Creek. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar and Automated Surface Observations. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Choteau, Cascade, Fairfield, Augusta, Fort Shaw, Wolf Creek, Fort Shaw, Pishkun Reservoir, Nilan Reservoir, Bean Lake, First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park, Sun River, Bowmans Corner, Tower Rock State Park, Craig, Ulm and Simms. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 225 and 273. Highway 200 between mile markers 96 and 139. Highway 287 between mile markers 1 and 64. Highway 89 between mile markers 9 and 48, and between mile markers 5 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
